ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. At times, I have misunderstood other people's attitudes towards me.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 2. My interpretations of my experiences are definitely right.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 3. Other people can understand the cause of my unusual experiences better than I can
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 4. I have jumped to conclusions too fast.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 5. Some of my experiences that have seemed very real may have been due to my imagination.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 6. Some of the ideas I was certain were true turned out to be false
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 7. If something feels right, it means that it is right.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 8. Even though I feel strongly that I am right, I could be wrong.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 9. I know better than anyone else what my problems are
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 10. When people disagree with me, they are generally wrong.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 11. I cannot trust other people's opinion about my experiences.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 12. If somebody points out that my beliefs are wrong, I am willing to consider it.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 13. I can trust my own judgment at all times
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 14. There is often more than one possible explanation for why people act the way they do.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: 15. My unusual experiences may be due to my being extremely upset or stressed.
Notes: 0=Do not agree at all; 1=Agree slightly; 2=Agree a lot; 3=Agree completely

ElementDescription: Beck Cognitive Insight Scale (BCIS), self-reflectiveness subscale total
Beck Cognitive Insight Scale (BCIS), self-certainty subscale total
Beck Cognitive Insight Scale (BCIS), total
Notes: 999=missing/NA/NK

ElementDescription: Visit name
Study condition to which participant was assigned
Notes: 1 = Cognitive remediation; 2 = Comparison condition; 3 = Other; 4= treatment as usual; 5= Computers first; 6= CRT first; 7=SCIT

ElementDescription: Site
Notes: Study Site
